title: Former Executive at Time Buys Ziff Davis
title_page: Former Executive at Time Buys Ziff Davis - The New York Times
maintext:
Vivek Shah, a former Time Inc. executive, has bought Ziff Davis, the media company that operates nine technology Web sites, including PCMag.com.
In an interview on Friday, Mr. Shah said that the acquisition, which he made in partnership with Great Hill Partners, a Boston firm, was the start of a new digital media company.
Mr. Shah, who will become the company’s chief executive, said that three aspects of Ziff Davis appealed to him. The company was already all digital (he wanted no print or traditional media), had vertical content (the topics are specialized), and had a large “in-market” audience (people looking to buy something).
“If you’re reading five printer reviews, I probably have a sense that you are in the market for a printer,” Mr. Shah said. “There are signals that we can begin to study that will give us a view as to who is a buyer of what. We think there’s a value to be created from that.”
